intro: Micrampelis lobata, commonly known as the creeping lichenwood, is a unique plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woody growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are arranged in a compact, mat-like formation. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Micrampelis lobata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
